Submodules¶

loss.MarginLoss module¶

class loss.MarginLoss.MarginLoss(**kwargs)¶

Bases: loss.Loss

Standard triplet loss

Calculates the margin loss of a mini-batch.

Args (kwargs only):

margin (float): Margin constraint to use in triplet liming. If not provided, loss uses torch.nn.SoftMarginLoss. Else uses nn.SoftMarginLoss. mine (str): Mining method. Default ‘hard’. Supports [‘hard’, ‘all’].

__call__()¶

Returns loss given features and labels.

average_mine(distances, labels)¶
euclidean_dist(x, y)¶
hard_mine(distances, labels)¶

loss.SoftmaxLabelSmooth module¶

class loss.SoftmaxLabelSmooth.SoftmaxLabelSmooth(**kwargs)¶

Bases: loss.Loss

Softmax with label smoothing

Performs softmax with label smoothing.

Args (kwargs only):

soft_dim (int): Dimension of the softmax layer. Used for the smoothing constant scaling. eps (float): Smothing constant. Default 0.1

__call__()¶

Returns loss given logits and labels.

Standard softmax loss

Calculates the softmax loss.

__call__()¶

loss.TripletLoss module¶

class loss.TripletLoss.TripletLoss(**kwargs)¶

Bases: loss.Loss

Standard triplet loss

Calculates the triplet loss of a mini-batch.

Args (kwargs only):

margin (float, 0.3): Margin constraint to use in triplet loss. If not provided, mine (str): Mining method. Default ‘hard’. Supports [‘hard’, ‘all’].

__call__()¶

Returns loss given features and labels.

all_mining(features, labels, margin, squared=False)¶

Build the triplet loss over a batch of features.

We generate all the valid triplets and average the loss over the positive ones.

Parameters

  • labels – labels of the batch, of size (batch_size,)

  • features – tensor of shape (batch_size, embed_dim)

  • margin – margin for triplet loss

  • squared – Boolean. If true, output is the pairwise squared euclidean distance matrix. If false, output is the pairwise euclidean distance matrix.

Returns

scalar tensor containing the triplet loss

Return type

triplet_loss

hard_mining(features, labels, margin, squared=False, device='cpu')¶

Build the triplet loss over a batch of features.

For each anchor, we get the hardest positive and hardest negative to form a triplet.

Parameters

  • labels – labels of the batch, of size (batch_size,)

  • features – tensor of shape (batch_size, embed_dim)

  • margin – margin for triplet loss

  • squared – Boolean. If true, output is the pairwise squared euclidean distance matrix. If false, output is the pairwise euclidean distance matrix.

Returns

scalar tensor containing the triplet loss

Return type

triplet_loss
